question_sentence: Which show won a record-breaking 18 Emmy awards at this year's ceremony?
evidence: FX's adaptation of James Clavell's epic tale of feudal Japan swept the boards, picking up the award for best drama, as well as best actor and actress awards for Hiroyuki Sanada and Anna Sawai. The previous record – 13 – was held by "John Adams", HBO's 2008 prestige mini-series about the life of the founding father.

question_sentence: Nearly 100,000 Arizona residents may be prohibited from voting in state elections for which reason?
choices: Not voting in the last election
evidence: Maricopa County Recorder Stephen Richer asked the Arizona Supreme Court to block nearly 100,000 residents from voting because the state has no evidence they submitted proof of citizenship as required under a 2004 state law.

question_sentence: What percentage of Japan's population is 65 or older, according to newly released figures?
evidence: Almost a third of Japan's population is now aged 65 or over, totalling around 36.25 million people – and with birth rates in the country stubbornly low, it's unclear who is going to support the swelling ranks of retirees in the future. Find out more on this week's episode of The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Amazon Prime's new miniseries "A Very Royal Scandal" focuses on the real-life drama around which royal?
evidence: The show is a dramatisation of the events around the Duke of York's disastrous 2019 interview with Emily Maitlis on "Newsnight", in which he addressed allegations surrounding his friendship with Jeffrey Epstein.

question_sentence: Big Four accounting firm PwC has announced plans to roll out what workplace change?
evidence: The firm, which employs more than 360,000 people worldwide, will use surveillance technology to monitor where employees are working from, to monitor office attendance and cut down on unauthorised remote working. PwC joins a growing number of employers turning to tech to keep a closer eye on its staff.

question_sentence: Which US Supreme Court justice is under scrutiny over a leaked memo in which they appeared to push for Donald Trump to receive immunity?
evidence: The Supreme Court chief justice, long viewed as a moderate presence among the nine members, sent a now-leaked memo to his fellow justices in February in which he critiqued a lower-court decision allowing the case against Donald Trump to proceed despite his claim of presidential immunity.

question_sentence: The UK Labour Party is "interested" in Italy's policy of sending asylum seekers rescued at sea to which country?
evidence: Keir Starmer's interest in the "Italian plan", brought in under right-wing prime minister Giorgia Meloni, sparked accusations of hypocrisy, given his party's vocal opposition to the Rwanda scheme. Italy says irregular migration has fallen by 62% since the plan was introduced last year.

question_sentence: Which social media platform has introduced "teen accounts" in response to parental concerns?
evidence: Meta announced that all Instagram accounts for users under 18 will be modified to enhance privacy, making them private by default and requiring parental consent for certain settings.

question_sentence: Court proceedings have begun in media tycoon Rupert Murdoch's battle to pass on his empire to which of his children, hand-picked as his heir?
evidence: At present, Murdoch's four oldest children have equal voting rights over their father's empire when he dies. But Murdoch is fighting to give full control to Lachlan, in a lawsuit that has been compared to the TV show "Succession" – itself allegedly inspired by Murdoch family politics.

question_sentence: Which content creator is facing a lawsuit for alleged mistreatment of contestants on their forthcoming game show?
evidence: Five contestants in the YouTuber's upcoming reality series "Beast Games" have filed a class action lawsuit against his production company and Amazon, claiming they received inadequate food, hygiene products and medical care.

question_sentence: A supermoon was visible to millions of sky-gazers around the world this week. What was the name of the lunar event?
evidence: September’s full harvest moon shone brightly Tuesday night. For about an hour, it also appeared as if a bite had been taken out of it due to a partial lunar eclipse.

question_sentence: A suspect was arrested after targeting former President Donald Trump in a second apparent assassination attempt. In which state did the incident occur?
evidence: The FBI is investigating what it said is an apparent assassination attempt on Trump at his golf club on Sunday in West Palm Beach, Florida.

question_sentence: Which service did the US make available to millions of Americans this week?
evidence: Americans who are renewing their passports will now be able to do so online. The service is open to adults who are renewing a regular 10-year passport that has expired within the past five years or expires in the coming year.

question_sentence: Which social media platform said it will implement new settings that will automatically make millions of teen accounts private?
evidence: Instagram announced its most dramatic effort yet to protect young users from dangers on its platform, implementing new “teen account” settings that will automatically make millions of teen accounts private and restrict what kinds of content those users can view on the app.

question_sentence: Which US government agency announced a huge interest rate cut for the first time since 2020?
evidence: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday announced a jumbo interest rate cut, marking its first since the onset of the Covid-19 pandemic. The half-point move paves the way for lower borrowing costs on everything from mortgages to credit cards.

question_sentence: What is America's most visited national park?
evidence: Great Smoky Mountains National Park, on the Tennessee-North Carolina border, is America's most visited national park. Its highest peak is now officially reverting to its Cherokee name after more than 150 years.

question_sentence: Which country in the Middle East was rocked by deadly walkie-talkie and pager explosions this week?
evidence: Lebanon is reeling from twin attacks targeting walkie-talkies and pagers belonging to Hezbollah members. Israel’s defense minister said Wednesday a “new era” of war was beginning, tacitly acknowledging its role in the wireless device attacks.

question_sentence: Which new business venture did former President Donald Trump and his children unveil this week?
evidence: With little time left in the 2024 race, former President Donald Trump and his children launched a new cryptocurrency business this week that experts say could be full of potential risks and conflicts if he wins.

question_sentence: Which labor union declined to endorse a presidential candidate this week?
evidence: The Teamsters, which represent truck drivers, freight workers and other workers in the US, declined to endorse a presidential candidate on Wednesday. It’s the first time in nearly three decades that the union has not backed a presidential candidate.

question_sentence: The 76th Primetime Emmy Awards took place in which city?
evidence: The Primetime Emmy Awards, which honor the best in American television, were handed out Sunday in Los Angeles. See the full list of winners here.

question_sentence: What significant announcement did U.S. Senator Tom Carper make regarding his political career?
choices: He plans to run for re-election in 2024.
He will retire at the end of his current term.
He will run for Governor of Delaware.

question_sentence: What is the primary goal of the new teacher training package created by the Christina School District in Delaware?
choices: To reduce the number of standardized tests.
To increase funding for school sports programs.
To introduce new technology in classrooms.
To enhance teachers’ knowledge of Black history and the arts.

question_sentence: What prompted Delaware to issue a swimming advisory for its ocean beaches?
choices: High levels of bacteria in the water
An oil spill affecting the beaches

question_sentence: What action did the Lewes Fire Department take against the volunteer who used a racial slur over the radio?
choices: The volunteer was given a 30-day suspension, removed from office, and required to undergo diversity training.
The volunteer was given a warning but no further action was taken.
The volunteer was transferred to another department.

question_sentence: What caused the collision between the school bus and the tractor in the Colonial School District bus crash?
choices: The school bus driver lost control of the bus.
The tractor driver tried to turn left from the shoulder and crossed into the bus’s path.
The tractor driver was driving on the wrong side of the road.

question_sentence: What is Delaware’s average IQ score according to the study by Data Pandas?
What was the outcome of the 2019 game between Delaware and Penn?
What role did Delaware play in the creation of the Monopoly board game 120 years ago?
choices: Delaware was the location where the first Monopoly board was manufactured.
A woman from Delaware created a board game similar to Monopoly 20 years before Parker Brothers patented their version.
Delaware was the headquarters of Parker Brothers when they patented Monopoly.
The first Monopoly tournament was held in Delaware.

question_sentence: What is the name of the Philadelphia Eagles podcast co-hosted by Dalton Holland?
What is the estimated cost for the long-term project to replenish the north side beach at Indian River Inlet?
